channel.title: Happy Thursday – Tea from Around the World
channel.description: Recent content on Happy Thursday – Tea from Around the World

item.title: Tea from Inner Mongolia
item.description: Tea: Salty Milk Tea Snacks: Milk Brick, Dried Milk Candy, Inner Mongolia-styled Yogurt & Milk Urum Fun fact: Inner Mongolian drink their tea seasoned with salt! Previous Next

item.title: Tea from Indonesia
item.description: Tea: Indonesian Black Tea Snacks: Klepon, Kue Lapis and Wajik Fun fact: When being asked to describe Indonesia in one sentence, Ben said “Unity in Diversity”, a national motto from his country. Previous Next

item.title: Tea from Vietnam
item.description: TCoffee: Cà Phê Phin (Vietnamese Filter Coffee) Snacks: Kẹo dừa (Coconut Candy), Chicken Floss with Hot Chili Sauce, Dried Banana and Lotus Fun fact: According to Alicia, even though Vietnam is famous for its filter coffee and craft coffee shops, most of the Vietnamese still prefer to drink instant coffee everyday! Previous Next

item.title: Tea from Oman
item.description: Tea and Coffee: Kahwa (Omani Coffee) Fun fact: This bitter coffee drink Kahwa is usually served with sweet dates.

item.title: Tea from India
item.description: Tea: Bhaji (Potato Balls) Snacks: Ginger and Cardamom Tea Fun fact: Yusuf explained the way we call a beverage “tea” or “cha” reflects how it was introduced to a certain country by land or by sea. If it is called “tea”, it means it was transported by sea; and if it is called “cha”, it means by land. Previous Next
